etymology.description: semantic: 骨(骨) (gǔ, "bone") + phonetic: 豊(豐) (lǐ, "abundant") = structure and form -> body
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 骨(骨) (gǔ, "bone") to convey the idea of a physical structure with 豊(豐) (lǐ, "abundant") for its phonetic element. The combination suggests a well-formed body.
etymology.simplification: 體(體)→体(體): The 豊(豐) component was replaced by the simpler 大(大) (dà, "big") as a streamlined phonetic element.

examples.chinese: 他的体态优美(他的體態優美)。
这幅画运用了独特的体裁(這幅畫運用了獨特的體裁)，展现出艺术家的风格(展現出藝術家的風格)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè fú huà yùnyòngle dútè de tǐcái, zhǎnxiàn chū yìshùjiā de fēnggé.
examples.english: This painting employs a unique form, showcasing the artist's style.

examples.chinese: 这种字体简洁明快(這種字體簡潔明快)，蕴含传统韵味(蘊含傳統韻味)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhǒng zìtǐ jiǎnjié míngkuài, yùnhán chuántǒng yùnwèi.
examples.english: This typeface is concise and bright, containing traditional charm.
